title: 'He can have a little peace': How Mookie Betts broke his slump in the biggest way
content: After a 3-for-23 start, Betts finally delivered with the clutch two-run hit that saved the Dodgers' season.

title: Dodgers survive dramatic ninth to force Game 7
content: The Dodgers escaped with a Game 6 victory over the Blue Jays after a wild ninth inning that included a fortuitous ground-rule double and a stunning game-ending double play.

title: Jays' Barger: 'Bad read' led to game-ending play
content: Blue Jays right fielder Addison Barger, who was doubled off at second base to end Game 6, acknowledged he made a "bad read" off the bat.

title: L.A. plans to start Ohtani in G7; Jays go Scherzer
content: The Dodgers are learning toward starting Shohei Ohtani on short rest in Game 7 of the World Series, with every pitcher available except Yoshinobu Yamamoto. Toronto will start Max Scherzer, also with nearly everyone available, including Trey Yesavage.

title: Doncic in Wilt's club after another 40-point night
content: Luka Doncic became just the second player in NBA history to open his season with three straight 40-point games, dropping 44 in a 117-112 win over the Grizzlies.

title: Morant: 'Ask the coaching staff' about struggles
content: After being held to a season-low eight points, Ja Morant told reporters to "go ask the coaching staff" about his struggles.

title: Bulls start 5-0 for 1st time since '90s Jordan era
content: The Bulls are the lone undefeated team remaining in the Eastern Conference, improving to 5-0 for the first time since the 1996-97 season with a 135-125 victory over the Knicks.

title: Sources: SMU, Lashlee nearing lucrative new deal
content: Rhett Lashlee and SMU are closing in on a new agreement that is expected to place him among the 10 highest-paid coaches in college football, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Indiana and Ohio State are locks. Where do other CFP hopefuls stand?
content: Can Vandy keep rolling? Can Texas stay relevant? Will Georgia Tech avoid an upset? Week 10 will tell all.

title: How Vanderbilt has gone from SEC doormat to CFP contender
content: After years of being a punching bag, coach Clark Lea and the 7-1 Commodores are showing plenty of fight.

title: NBA Cup takeaways: Bulls tip off annual in-season competition with win over Knicks
content: The 2025 NBA Cup tipped off on Oct. 31. Here's everything you need to know about the third annual in-season tournament, including schedule and rule changes.

title: Passan: Why nothing beats Game 7 of the World Series
content: The Dodgers and Blue Jays have graced us with a winner-take-all Fall Classic finale -- something no other sport can match.

title: We've got a Game 7! Everything you need to know ahead of winner-take-all finale
content: On Saturday, a champion will be crowned. Will it be an L.A. repeat or Toronto's first title in 32 years?

title: Ready for NFL Week 9? We have sleepers, potential surprises, trends to watch and more
content: Will Christian McCaffrey and Sam Darnold go off? Can the Steelers upset the Colts? And could the Bills slow the Chiefs? Here's what to know for Week 9.

content: It's time to see whether McCarthy can stay healthy and live up to the hype as the 2024 No. 10 draft pick.

content: Answering the key questions following the Dolphins' decision to part ways with Chris Grier and keep Mike McDaniel.

content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

content: At Week 9, what should fantasy managers believe, or not believe, about Drake Maye, Oronde Gadsden II and more?

content: NYC Marathon pacers are the human metronomes keeping runners on track in the race's most challenging moments.

content: We picked out the best players at every position from the past 25 years who got trapped on awful rosters. Could Myles Garrett's 2025 season end up on the list?

title: 🎠 Resetting the college football coaching carousel
content: Coaching changes are happening fast. With a month left in the season, here are six things to monitor.

title: 🏈 Governor: LSU AD won't select football coach
content: Louisiana Gov. Jeff Landry told reporters Wednesday that LSU athletic director Scott Woodward won't be involved in selecting the Tigers' new football coach in the wake of Brian Kelly's firing.

title: 🏀 Jordan: Load management never should happen
content: Michael Jordan didn't hold back on load management in the NBA, saying on NBC: "It shouldn't be needed, first and foremost."

title: ⚾ Chapman: I'd rather retire than rejoin Yankees
content: Aroldis Chapman ripped the Yankees in a podcast, saying he would "retire on the spot" before playing for them ever again.

title: 👑 The legend of Georgia Tech QB Haynes King
content: Stories about how the quarterback became one of the quirkiest, toughest and most insatiable players in college football.

title: ↔️ Pats trade White to 49ers, Dugger to Steelers
content: The Patriots traded away two former defensive starters Tuesday night, sending defensive end Keion White to the 49ers and safety Kyle Dugger to the Steelers, sources told ESPN.

title: The Mavs are turning the page from Doncic to Flagg with the help of veteran stars
content: Anthony Davis and Kyrie Irving are helping the No. 1 pick adjust to playoff expectations as a rookie.

title: 17 men's college basketball teams that could win 30 games in 2025-26
content: History says a 30-win season could lead to a national title (see: Florida). Which teams could achieve the feat this season?

content: Will UConn or St. John's win the Big East? Here are questions that could shape every league in 2025-26.

title: Tudor's Juve exit means McKennie must prove himself all over again
content: Weston McKennie has already proven himself to several Juventus managers, but with Igor Tudor getting fired, he now has another new boss to impress.

title: Briscoe, Byron, Hamlin, Larson: Who will be crowned NASCAR champion on Sunday?
content: Just four drivers are left standing in NASCAR's 2025 playoffs, and come Sunday afternoon in Phoenix, one of them will be crowned Cup Series champion.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Two win streaks on the line at UFC Fight Night
content: One fighter's unbeaten streak will come to an end when David Onama and Steve Garcia clash at UFC Fight Night. MMA experts and a betting insider make their picks.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United target Sporting's Hjulmand
content: Sporting CP midfielder Morten Hjulmand is on Manchester United's transfer shortlist. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Police raid rave party at homestay in Kaggalipura, over 130 detained
content: According to police, many of them were college students and working professionals from Bengaluru, and three of them were minors

title: Opposition parties corner BJP over diluting Panjab University’s senate and syndicate
content: The move by the Centre trampled on Punjab’s hard-earned autonomy, academic freedom, and Constitutional rights, State Education Minister and AAP leader Harjot Singh Bains said, terming it a ‘blatant assault on the very soul of Punjab’

title: Kuki-Zo community skips Kut festival in Manipur amid ongoing ethnic tensions
content: Kut, also known as the Chavang Kut, is celebrated every year by the Kuki-Zo communities across the state to mark the completion of the harvest season

title: CBI arrests ‘key member’ of cybercrime syndicate that targeted Japanese citizens
content: The accused operated an illegal call centre that was involved in sophisticated social engineering and deception, according to the agency; so far, seven individuals have been arrested and chargesheeted in the case

title: Railways warns people against getting close to high-voltage overhead wires
content: Following two cases of electrocution reported Ulundurpet Goods Yard, the Railways has issued an advisory on the norms to be followed near level crossings and subways

title: Andhra Pradesh likely to experience a warmer November
content: In its forecast for the month, the IMD says the State may see above-normal minimum and normal to above-normal maximum temperatures

title: Former Ministers blame Andhra Pradesh government for Kasibugga temple stampede
content: Dharmana Prasada Rao and Sidiri Appalaraju fault administration for poor crowd management; CPI(M) seeks compensation for victims’ families

title: From Maoist violence to symbol of prosperity and security, Chhattisgarh's journey inspiring: PM Modi
content: Legislative Assembly is not merely a place for framing laws but a vibrant centre for shaping the State's destiny,’ says the Prime Minister

title: Jeddah-Hyderabad IndiGo flight diverted to Mumbai after 'human bomb' threat, aircraft lands safely
content: The airport authorities lodged a complaint with police, saying they received the threat email at around 5.30 a.m. which warned them to "prevent landing of IndiGo (flight) in Hyderabad"

title: MVA-MNS hold 'Satyacha Morcha' in Mumbai to corner ECI on voters list irregularities
content: The Opposition has accused the Election Commission of India of turning a blind eye to the issue, has asserted that local body polls in Maharashtra should go ahead only after shortcomings are rectified

title: Jharkhand Governor demands strict action in HIV-infected blood transfusion case
content: Family of a seven-year-old thalassemia patient on October 24 alleged that the local blood bank in Chaibasa, the district headquarters town of West Singhbhum, had transfused HIV-infected blood.

title: New freshwater crab genus identified in Yercaud
content: The discovery highlights the ecological significance of the Eastern Ghats, a region that remains comparatively less studied than the Western Ghats

title: Visitors throng the four Presidential estates across India now open to the public
content: From Rashtrapati Bhavan to ‘Rashtra ka bhavan’: the number of people visiting in-person rose from about seven lakh pre-pandemic to over 20.5 lakh in 2024

title: Permanent solution planned for Nallamada Drain, says Union Minister
content: Floodwaters from Bapatla, Palnadu and surrounding regions converge into the Nallamada Drain, which has a capacity of 22,000 cusecs but received nearly 42,000 cusecs during the recent storm,  Pemmasani explained

title: Eluru Police bust digital arrest racket with links to China, U.S., Singapore
content: Cyber offenders confined a 66-year-old for 72 hours on the name of ‘digital arrest’ and extorted ₹51.90 lakh in multiple transactions, says IGP Ake Ravi Krishna

title: Kashmir authorities warn against people impersonating mediapersons for blackmail, extortion
content: People have been found misusing the name of the media for "blackmail, extortion, coercion of officials and circulation of unverified and defamatory material against public institutions and officers," said Joint Director Information of Kashmir

title: Two students killed, five critically injured in school van-SUV collision in Rajasthan
content: A school van accident in Itawa, Rajasthan, claimed the lives of two students and injured five others on November 1 morning, with officials citing a tyre burst as the cause of the collision

title: Supreme Court exercise plenary powers to quash POCSO case against man who later married victim
content: The Supreme Court criminal law is a manifestation of the sovereign will of society, but the administration of such law is not divorced from practical realities

title: Two officers suspended in Dular Chand Yadav murder case in Mokama
content: Two Station House Officers (SHOs) have been suspended following the death of Jan Suraaj supporter Dular Chand Yadav, causing widespread political uproar and potentially influencing poll battle in Mokama

title: MDU official, two sanitation supervisors in Rohtak booked for asking female workers to prove menstruation
content: ‘We told them we could not work faster as we were unwell due to our periods, but they abused and threatened us with dismissal,’ says a sanitation worker

title: Sengottaiyan’s expulsion will prove to be self-destructive for Palaniswami: Dhinakaran
content: “Mr. Sengottaiyan has been removed from the party because of Mr. Palaniswami’s selfishness and hunger for power,” Mr. Dhinakaran charged

title: Need for on-campus reptile conservation in urbanising world, studies show
content: An average of approximately 25 species of serpents have been recorded across four higher education institutions in India over two years; the latest study on snake diversity was conducted at Tezpur University in Assam

title: Sabarimala temple artefacts case: Kerala High Court-appointed SIT makes third arrest
content: Officials identified the suspect as D. Sudheesh Kumar, a former Travancore Devaswom Board executive officer who served at the temple in 2019

title: Sengottaiyan never speaks against DMK, is part of its B-team, alleges Palaniswami
content: Mr. Palaniswami, who participated in a meeting with AIADMK party functionaries in Salem, told reporters that for the past six months, Mr. Sengottaiyan’s activities had been along anti-party lines

title: Mulberry shoot harvester-cum-bundling machine demonstrated in Kolar district of Karnataka
content: The device was developed jointly by Central Sericultural Research and Training Institute (CSRTI) in Mysuru and SRR Agro Industries, Sircilla, Telangana, under a collaborative research project aimed at promoting mechanization in sericulture.

title: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee to hit the streets in Kolkata against SIR on November 4
content: Trinamool Congress has also sent a complaint to the office of Chief Electoral Officer (CEO) West Bengal alleging that Leader of Opposition in West Bengal Assembly Suvendu Adhikari has issued threats to Booth Level Officers (BLOs)

title: Bihar Assembly polls: NDA indulges in divisive politics, propagating fake nationalism, alleges Priyanka
content: Addressing her maiden poll rally at Begusarai in the Bihar polls this year, she claimed that there is "no double-engine government in the State as everything is controlled from Delhi"

title: Kasibugga temple stampede: Union Minister Rammohan Naidu directs police personnel to inquire into ghastly incident
content: Minister Rammohan Naidu who is in Bhopal cancelled his official programmes to come back to Srikakulam district to console the families of deceased persons

title: Indian Endodontic Society presents IES Medal of Honor 2025 to first endodontist from Karnataka Dr. N. Rajeeva Shetty
content: Dr. N. Rajeeva Shetty, an eminent teacher, former principal and HOD of Government Dental College, Bengaluru, went on to become the first Indian dentist to be made Director of Medical Education (DME) by a State Government in India

title: Operation Sindoor carried out with combined strength of principles, technology: Army Chief Gen. Dwivedi
content: Gen. Dwivedi asserted that India had only destroyed terrorist infrastructure in the neighbouring country

title: Bihar Assembly polls: ‘Jungle raj’ will return if RJD comes back to power, says Amit Shah
content: The Union Home Minister who was scheduled to address election rally in Gopalganj, spoke virtually as bad weather prevented him from reaching venue

title: Venkateswara Swamy Temple owner booked on charges of 'culpable homicide' says Srikakulam SP
content: Devotees fell on from a six-feet-wall in an attempt to escape from rush of devotees after damage to an iron railing, says SP K.V. Maheswara Reddy

title: Property owners on Road No. 92 protest acquisition for Hyderabad-CITI project near KBR Park
content: They proposed making entire stretch around KBR Park a one-way, without having to spend a fortune on flyovers and underpasses

title: T.N. CM Stalin inaugurates work for proposed eco-park on Madras Race Club campus
content: The State government has proposed to develop a 118-acre eco-park, which includes the development of four ponds as flood-control and rainwater preservation measures, on the Madras Race Club grounds

title: Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan calls for strict management of queue lines at temples
content: Pawan Kalyan said the officials were instructed to provide the best possible medical care to the injured, and to take necessary relief and rescue operations

title: Palakkad MLA Rahul Mamkootathil’s presence at ASHAs’ agitation raises eyebrows; sparks political theatre
content: KAHWA leader S. Mini told The Hindu that the protestors had invited an array of leaders sympathetic to their cause, including Rahul Mamkootathil

title: Team spirit, technology adoption helped in mitigating impact of Montha: Andhra CM Chandrababu Naidu
content: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu stated that the experience gained from the manner in which cyclone Montha has been dealt with would be compiled into a manual

title: Dular Chand Yadav died due to cardiorespiratory failure: post-mortem report
content: "The reason behind Yadav's death is cardiorespiratory failure due to shock caused by injury of the heart and lungs by a hard and blunt substance," said the report submitted to the Patna Police

title: At least nine killed at Kasibugga temple; Venkateswara Swamy Temple owner booked on charges of 'culpable homicide' | Live
content: PM Modi announces ₹2 lakh ex-gratia to kin of victims; CM Naidu ordered officials to ensure the injured receive better medical treatment

title: Sengottaiyan terms expulsion from AIADMK ‘unjustified’, calls Palaniswami a ‘temporary’ general secretary
content: “I wish to continue as a member of the AIADMK, and I will file a case in this regard,” he told reporters at his farmhouse in Kullampalayam

title: At least nine people dead in stampede in A.P.’s Srikakulam district
content: CM Naidu expressed condolences and also said that he directed officials to ensure better treatment for the injured persons

title: India always first responder in any global crisis: PM Modi in Chhattisgarh
content: Guided by the mantra that the development of the state leads to the development of the nation, the government is engaged in the Viksit Bharat mission to make India developed, Mr. Modi said

title: Himanta's comments show he is 'unfit' to be CM: Gaurav on 'Pakistani agent' remarks
content: Mr. Gogoi criticised the timing of the allegations on the day when the State's cultural icon Zubeen Garg's last movie was released on Friday.

title: MoEF&CC recommends environmental clearance to AM/NS steel plant in Anakapalli district of Andhra Pradesh
content: “With an overall investment commitment of ₹1.50 lakh crore, the AM/NS project is going to be India’s largest greenfield steel plant to date,” according to an official release

title: Army Commander visits LAC in Eastern Ladakh, reviews operational and defence preparedness
content: ‘Lt. Gen. Pratik Sharma visited forward posts in the Tangtse sector of Eastern Ladakh to review the operational readiness and defence preparedness,’ says officials

title: Goa sees overall 6% rise in tourist arrivals; international inflow up by 29%: Minister
content: “For the first time, Goa has seen growth during the monsoon months,” State Tourism Minister Rohan Khaunte says

title: BJP MP's remark on ‘removing border fences’ with Bangladesh sparks row in West Bengal
content: BJP Ranaghat MP Jagannath Sarkar can be heard saying that if the BJP wins the elections, then there will be no border fence with Bangladesh.  Trinamool Congress leader Abhishek Banerjee has sought action against the BJP MP.

title: Jaipur’s royal legacy finds a contemporary voice in a jewellery and apparel collection
content: Inspired by Jaipur’s historic Pachranga flag, the Tribe Amrapali x The Palace Atelier collaboration merges lineage with lifestyle

title: This Changed My Life | Art director Thota Tharani reflects on life-changing influences
content: One of Indian cinema’s most successful art director Thota Tharani, talks to us about artists, directors, and classical musicians who changed his life. He speaks of his early artistic influences and his time working with other legends like directors Mani Ratnam and Singeetam Srinivasa Rao, actor Kamal Haasan, and music director Ilayaraaja

title: Himachal CM Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu flags off ₹29.50 crore development projects in Sri Renukaji constituency
content: CM Sukhu inaugurated Government Industrial Training Institute building at Maina Bag in Sangrah tehsil constructed at a cost of ₹6.47 crore and sub-market yard at Nohradhar

title: Tripura tops list of NE States in implementing scheme to promote solar energy use in agri sector
content: Manik Saha said the recognition reflects his government’s "unwavering commitment to promoting clean energy, rural empowerment, and sustainable development"

title: Stubble management to be done with decomposer wettable powder: Haryana Minister
content: This initiative will not only eliminate the need for burning crop residue but also help enhance soil fertility, Haryana Agriculture Minister Shyam Singh Rana

title: Railway Ministry approves Vande Bharat service between Bengaluru and Ernakulam, via Coimbatore
content: The train will stop at Krishnarajapuram, Salem, Erode, Tiruppur, Coimbatore, Palakkad, and Thrissur, Says the Railway Board communication

title: Delhi's winter atmosphere unsuitable for cloud seeding: IIT Delhi report
content: Due to a lack of sufficient moisture and saturation during the winter months of December and January, cloud seeding is a non-viable solution that offers only short-lived benefits, says the study

title: Projects worth ₹1.78 lakh crore to be launched by December: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma
content: “With the pouring in of investments and projects, youth will find more employment opportunities within the State,” CM Himanta said

title: My life changed after bathing in Ganga, adopted vegetarianism: Vice-President Radhakrishnan
content: C.P. Radhakrishnan, along with Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath, inaugurates the new satram constructed by the Sri Kasi Nattukkottai Nagara Satram Managing Society in Varanasi

title: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar urges people to vote for NDA once again for development
content: “We prioritised the restoration of law and order and established the rule of law in the State. Now, being a Bihari is a matter of pride for the residents of the State," the Chief Minister said in a video posted on X

title: Indo-Pacific should remain free from any form of coercion: Rajnath
content: The Defence Minister also said that India is for strengthening the ASEAN-led inclusive regional security architecture

title: Five held for 'assault' of four student leaders in Manipur
content: Based on an FIR registered at Kakching Police Station in connection with the alleged assault, they were apprehended on Friday, and two vehicles were seized for verification, a police statement said.

title: ₹63.16 crore crop loss compensation disbursed in Dharwad district of Karnataka
content: Deputy Commissioner Divya Prabhu has said that the money has been given to 65,217 beneficiary farmers as per NDRF and SDRF guidelines

title: Zubeen death case: Post-mortem, toxicology reports from Singapore received by Assam Police
content: When our SIT visited Singapore, they had assured of cooperation. Today, the Singapore authorities have formally sent the post-mortem and toxicology reports and their guidelines related to sea under the Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty (MLAT), says Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma

title: Congress to appoint observers in Rajasthan to keep watch on SIR exercise
content: Pradesh Congress Committee president Dotasra said the Election Commission was not performing its duty of training the BLAs, compelling the Congress to do the needful through the observers

title: Fadnavis orders setting up of SIT to probe death of woman doctor in Phaltan
content: Devendra Fadnavis has directed the State Director General of Police to constitute an SIT under a woman IPS officer immediately

title: Last rites of hostage taker Rohit Arya performed in Pune
content: The last rites were performed in the presence of Arya's wife, son and other close members of his family

title: Bihar Assembly election LIVE: Priyanka Gandhi slams NDA over privatisation, SIR and more in Begusarai rally
content: "Don’t get fooled by promises of 'double-engine' govt in Bihar, everything controlled from Delhi," alleges Priyanka Gandhi Varda in Begusarai, Bihar

title: Marathon training sessions held at West Bengal CEO’s office for SIR
content: 3,000 officials were trained on Friday on how to the BLOs (Booth Level Officials) will use a mobile application to fill in enumeration forms.

title: Calcutta HC to hear petition demanding court-monitored SIR in WB, as Trinamool starts preparations
content: Trinamool Congress general secretary Abhishek Banerjee held a meeting with the party’s rank and directed party’s booth level agents BLAs not to leave Booth Level Officers BLOs for a minute during SIR

title: October ends with excess rainfall over T.N. for second consecutive year; IMD indicates below normal rains in November
content: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has forecast November rainfall in the State to be likely below normal rainfall.

title: Vellore Corporation begins desilting of old drains in Netaji market to prevent inundation
content: Corporation officials said that the existing Netaji wholesale market, which is 1.5 acres, has 982 shops including 282 retail outlets.

title: Headmaster suspended in Tiruvannamalai for social media posts against State government
content: Initial inquiry revealed that the headmaster has been making comments against government welfare schemes and other initiatives in various social media platforms regularly.

title: Two persons held for selling tablets near Walajah
content: Accordingly, a special police team was conducting a routine check near Walajah railway station when the team found the duo selling the tablets in a dilapidated building.

title: VIT Chancellor receives Lifetime achievement award
content: According to a press release, the award was given at the eighth Annual Conclave Federation of World Academics (FWA) held in New Delhi.

title: Mumbai hostage scare: Kids gagged, hands tied for hrs for 'scene’ shoot; witnesses recount horror
content: A chilling hostage drama unfolded in Mumbai when a web series shoot turned real. Children, believing they were filming a scene, were held captive for hours by the director, Rohit Aarrya, who threatened them with a gun and rod. Prepared with flammable materials, Aarrya's plan was revealed after he pulled out weapons, leading to a tense standoff and eventual rescue.

title: 'RJD to bring back jungle raj': BJP attacks on Tejashwi; cites Shahabuddin's son's nomination
content: The BJP has accused the RJD of reviving "baahubal" politics by fielding Mohammad Shahabuddin's son, Osama Shahab, from Siwan's Raghunathpur seat. BJP president JP Nadda warned of a return to "jungle raj," contrasting it with the development under Nitish Kumar and PM Modi. Voters are urged to support the NDA for stability and accelerated development.

title: IPL trade: RR, DC close to Samson, Tristan Stubbs swap; KKR press for KL Rahul— Exclusive
content: With Sanju Samson clear on leaving Rajasthan Royals, both Delhi Capitals and Rajasthan Royals have been locked in negotiations and many tradable options were discussed along the way. It is reliably learnt that Delhi Capitals are keen to have Samson on board but were not willing to trade any of their core players.

title: Same entry and exit points, crowd surge: What led to deadly Andhra temple stampede - 10 key points
content: A stampede at the Venkateswara Swami Temple in Andhra Pradesh's Srikakulam claimed at least 10 lives and injured several others as a large crowd gathered for Ekadashi. The privately managed temple, not registered with the state endowments department, lacked official approvals, contributing to the chaos. Injured devotees are receiving treatment, with authorities fearing a rise in the death toll.

title: 100,000+ layoffs: Intel, Microsoft, & others cut thousands of jobs; CEOs blame AI
content: The tech industry is undergoing a seismic shift with over 112,000 job cuts in 2025, driven by AI adoption and economic headwinds. Giants like Amazon, Intel, and TCS have slashed thousands of roles, impacting IT services, consulting, and manufacturing globally. This unprecedented workforce reduction highlights AI's transformative power, automating tasks and reshaping the employment landscape. Companies are prioritizing AI-focused roles while phasing out traditional positions, signaling a fundamental change in how businesses operate and compete.

title: Heartbreak to hope: Harmanpreet's emotional words ahead of World Cup final
content: India's captain Harmanpreet Kaur expressed her team's readiness to finally clinch a global title, having experienced the pain of past defeats. Ahead of the Women's World Cup final against South Africa, she emphasised the team's hard work and collective spirit. This marks India's third final appearance, and they are determined to make this a 'special day' for the nation.

title: Language row: Karnataka CM says English, Hindi hurting children’s talent
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah accused the central government of neglecting Kannada and imposing Hindi, stating the state receives a "paltry amount" in return for its significant revenue contribution. He called for opposition to "anti-Kannada" elements and advocated for laws to make the mother tongue the medium of instruction in education, arguing English and Hindi weaken children's talent.

title: Ekadashi rush: Stampede breaks out at Venkateswara Swami temple in Andhra; 9 killed
content: A tragic stampede at the Venkateswara Swami Temple in Kasibugga claimed the lives of five devotees and injured several others on Saturday morning. The incident occurred during Ekadashi, a sacred Hindu observance, as thousands of devotees gathered. Authorities reportedly struggled to manage the immense crowd, leading to the fatal crush.

title: UIDAI announces change in Aadhaar rules from November 1; here's what has changed
content: Effective November 1, 2025, Aadhaar updates for name, address, and mobile number can be initiated online via the myAadhaar portal, eliminating the need for in-person visits for many demographic changes. Biometric updates still require a visit to an Aadhaar Seva Kendra. The UIDAI has also revised fee structures and emphasized timely PAN-Aadhaar linkage.

title: NMC redefines faculty eligibility: New rules reshape teaching; clarity on appointments
content: The National Medical Commission (NMC) has issued detailed clarifications on the Medical Institutions (Qualifications of Faculty) Regulations, 2025, effective June 30. The FAQs outline eligibility norms for Senior Consultants, Professors, Associate Professors, and Assistant Professors, addressing experience criteria, transitional provisions, and equivalence across specialties to ensure uniform, transparent, and merit-based faculty recruitment nationwide.

title: Whopping! Rohit’s men got Rs 125 cr - how much will IND women get for World Cup win?
content: The Indian women's cricket team is set to play South Africa in the ICC Women's ODI World Cup final. A victory could bring a historic win and a significant cash reward. The BCCI is considering a prize comparable to the men's team's earnings for the 2024 T20 World Cup triumph. This move aligns with the board's commitment to equal pay for male and female cricketers.

title: Trump hails ‘great success’ after talks with Xi — But will it fix their economies?
content: US and China have reached a provisional trade deal, easing tariffs and pausing export curbs. While hailed as a success, the agreement may be too late for American soybean farmers and does little to address deeper economic woes in both nations.

title: 'Focus on' in internal memo: What Amazon VP told employees after 14,000 layoffs
content: Following significant layoffs in its devices division, Amazon VP Tapas Roy has urged remaining employees to embrace AI, cut bureaucracy, and prioritize customer-facing tasks.  Roy's directive, shared internally, emphasizes focusing on work that directly impacts customers and leveraging AI for enhanced effectiveness.  These changes align with CEO Andy Jassy's broader strategy to streamline operations.  The memo acknowledged the difficulty of the decisions, framing them as necessary for future success, and highlighted support resources for affected staff.

title: Shah Rukh Khan calls John Cena a 'rock star'; WWE legend's heartfelt reply wins hearts
content: WWE legend John Cena expressed his gratitude to Shah Rukh Khan on social media after the Bollywood star called him a "rock star." Cena revealed that Khan's TED Talk profoundly influenced his life, and they had an emotional meeting at a Mumbai wedding where Cena shared this impact.

title: Bopanna announces retirement; bids adieu after 22-year career
content: Indian tennis icon Rohan Bopanna has bid adieu to professional tennis after a stellar 20-year career. His final match was at the Paris Masters. Bopanna etched his name in history this year as the oldest Grand Slam winner and World No. 1 in doubles. He expressed immense pride in representing India throughout his journey.

title: Top cardiologist reveals the best exercise to lower blood pressure naturally
content: The American Heart Association suggests that adults aim for 150 minutes of moderate‑intensity aerobic activity each week, which can be broken down into five 30‑minute sessions. A brisk walk, a bike ride or a swim, all count toward that goal. Dr. London stresses that weaving exercise into routines is the most reliable way to secure heart health, and keep blood pressure in check

title: Bomb scare: Hyderabad airport receives threat email; IndiGo flight diverted
content: Early Saturday morning, a bomb threat at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport caused alarm as an IndiGo flight was rerouted. The threat originated from an email asserting that operatives linked to the LTTE and ISI were plotting an attack involving nerve gas and improvised explosive devices.

title: Telangana: Over 50 students hospitalised after having dinner at hostel
content: Fifty-two students from a state-run welfare hostel in Jogulamba Gadwal district, Telangana, were hospitalized after experiencing vomiting and stomach aches following dinner. Officials confirmed on Saturday that the students are clinically stable, with 32 already discharged. The affected students reported consuming sambar, rice, and cabbage curry before falling ill. A health camp is currently operating at the hostel.

title: Leon Draisaitl slams referees over Mika Zibanejad’s controversial penalty
content: Leon Draisaitl expressed frustration with a controversial officiating call that resulted in a minor penalty for a high stick, which he felt should have been a double minor. Despite the disputed call, Draisaitl also acknowledged the Oilers' own issues with turnovers and puck management contributing to their overtime loss to the Rangers.

title: 'My age may be young, but ... ': Tejashwi shares how he plans to fulfil govt job promise
content: Tejashwi Yadav, INDIA bloc's Bihar CM candidate, pledges to transform the state into a job creation hub, ending migration. He highlights plans for factories, educational institutions, and healthcare, contrasting them with the NDA's perceived lack of vision for Bihar. Yadav dismisses 'jungle raj' fears, emphasizing economic justice and inclusive development.

title: Shubman Gill hugs Abhishek Sharma's mother, bows to his father— watch
content: Childhood friends and Indian cricketers Shubman Gill and Abhishek Sharma showcased their deep bond when Gill greeted Abhishek's parents with a hug and a respectful gesture. This heartwarming moment resonated with fans, highlighting the enduring relationships built through cricket. Meanwhile, India faces Australia in a T20I series, currently trailing 0-1.

title: Steaming or boiling vegetables: Which cooking method is the healthiest?
content: Steaming vegetables is lauded as the healthiest method, preserving more water-soluble vitamins and antioxidants by using steam instead of direct water contact. Boiling, while simple and quick, leads to significant nutrient loss into the water. For optimal health benefits, steaming is generally preferred, though boiling has its place for certain vegetables and dishes.

title: 'We have approached ACC...': Asia Cup trophy row takes ugly twist; BCCI secy shares status
content: The BCCI will address the Asia Cup trophy handover at the upcoming ICC meeting. India refused to accept the trophy from Pakistan's Interior Minister and PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi. The BCCI has formally communicated with the ACC but received no response. India's stance remains firm on not receiving the trophy from Naqvi.

title: Andhra Pradesh stampede: Video shows moment panic erupted at temple
content: A devastating stampede at the Venkateswara Swami Temple in Kasibugga claimed at least ten lives and injured several others on Saturday morning. The chaotic surge occurred as devotees gathered for Ekadashi, overwhelming security and leading to a tragic loss of life. An investigation into the incident and crowd management is underway.

title: 'God bless you all!': Diljit shares hilarious moment with cricketers - Watch
content: Diljit Dosanjh, facing recent criticism, shared a heartwarming Instagram post with cricketers Arshdeep Singh and Jitesh Sharma in Australia. The trio recreated a viral moment from their "God Bless" song, with Jitesh humorously repeating his modified lyric. This friendly reunion, blending music and cricket, has garnered significant positive fan attention, showcasing Dosanjh's enduring appeal.

title: ‘Real mistake’: US treasury secy Scott Bessent slams China over rare earth controls
content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent criticized China's rare earth export restrictions as a "mistake" that "weaponized" the vital minerals.  Beijing's move alerted the world to the danger, prompting global backlash and a one-year suspension of certain limits following a US-China summit. Washington has prepared countermeasures against future controls.

title: Attention FASTag users! NHAI rolls out new rules for KYV process; What has changed?
content: The National Highways Authority of India has simplified the FASTag Know Your Vehicle (KYV) process, ensuring services remain active during pending verification.  Motorists now only need a front vehicle photo, and the system automatically retrieves RC details via Vahan.  Issuing banks will proactively assist users, and the helpline is available for support.

title: IND vs AUS: 'On what basis?' Ex-India captain blasts Gill’s T20I vice-captaincy decision
content: Former India captain Krishnamachari Srikkanth has criticized the appointment of Shubman Gill as T20I vice-captain, citing disruption to team balance and selection clarity. Srikkanth argued that Gill's guaranteed spot, due to his vice-captaincy, has blocked opportunities for in-form players like Yashasvi Jaiswal and created uncertainty for others.

title: Gautam Gambhir’s heated exchange with Suryakumar Yadav goes viral after MCG defeat - Watch
content: Following India's disappointing T20I loss to Australia, a video of coach Gautam Gambhir's animated discussion with captain Suryakumar Yadav has gone viral. The clip captures Gambhir's visible frustration after a batting collapse saw India post just 125.  The exchange, with assistant coaches present, highlights concerns over tactical decisions and batting execution as India trails 0-1 in the series.

title: Relief for India! Why Josh Hazlewood is not playing the third T20I in Hobart
content: India's top order breathes a sigh of relief as Australian pace spearhead Josh Hazlewood is rested for the third T20I in Hobart.  Hazlewood's devastating spell at the MCG had rattled India, but his absence offers a chance for the team to regroup.  Meanwhile, the omission of Arshdeep Singh continues to spark debate.

title: Bihar polls: RJD’s Khesari Yadav defends ‘Jungle Raj’; BJP says MGB’s true face exposed
content: BJP leaders Manoj Tiwari and Pawan Singh have strongly criticized RJD's Khesari Lal Yadav for his controversial remarks comparing Lalu Yadav's "Jungle Raj" favorably to Nitish Kumar's rule. Yadav had claimed people survived by paying ransom during "Jungle Raj," a statement the BJP deemed as revealing the "true face" of the Mahagathbandhan and highlighting their vision for Bihar's safety.

title: Who is Bankim Brahmbhatt? Indian-origin CEO accused of $500m scam at BlackRock
content: BlackRock's private credit arm, HPS Investment Partners, alleges a multi-million-dollar fraud by Bankim Brahmbhatt's telecom firms. Lenders claim Brahmbhatt fabricated receivables used as collateral for over $500 million in loans. Brahmbhatt's companies have filed for bankruptcy, and he is reportedly in India.

title: ICC Women’s World Cup: How India Women rose from mid-tournament slump
content: India's women's cricket team has reached the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup 2025 final after a remarkable turnaround. Following three consecutive defeats, they secured crucial wins against New Zealand and Australia, culminating in a stunning semifinal victory. Jemimah Rodrigues' unbeaten 127 led a record-breaking chase against Australia to set up a final clash with South Africa.

title: 'He was offended': Canada PM says he apologised to Trump over Reagan ad
content: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney apologized to President Donald Trump for an anti-tariff advertisement featuring Ronald Reagan, which Trump deemed "fake." Trump had previously announced a 10 percent tariff increase on Canadian goods and suspended trade talks following the ad's airing. Trade talks are expected to resume when the US is ready.

title: Chhattisgarh: PM Modi announces projects worth Rs 14k cr; inaugurates new Assembly building
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi marked Chhattisgarh's 25th Foundation Day by inaugurating development projects worth ₹14,260 crore. He interacted with children treated for congenital heart disease and unveiled a statue of Atal Bihari Vajpayee at the new assembly building. The PM emphasized state development for national progress and India's role as a global first responder.

title: Haryana teen held hostage on ‘dunki’ route to US, killed; family paid Rs 25L to agents
content: A Haryana youth, Yuvraj, was shot dead in Guatemala by smugglers after being held captive while attempting to enter the US via the illegal 'dunki' route. His family paid Rs 25 lakh in advance for the journey, but later received videos of him being beaten and threatened, demanding more money for his release.

title: Tariff row: GTRI's 3-step plan for India to protect its interests
content: A three-step strategy from GTRI aims to protect India's trade interests with the US. It proposes halting Russian oil imports under sanctions, seeking the removal of punitive tariffs, and resuming negotiations on fair, balanced terms for improved export competitiveness.

title: Watch: UP cop nabbed taking Rs 2 lakh bribe to drop name of rape accused; video viral
content: A Lucknow police sub-inspector has found himself in deep trouble after being caught in the act, taking a Rs 2 lakh bribe for a biased report regarding a gang rape incident. The entire transaction was recorded in a viral video—a key element of a sting operation by the Anti-Corruption Organisation.

title: Shreyas Iyer’s spleen injury: Doctor warns of hidden risks and need for quick action​​
content: Cricketer Shreyas Iyer's recent spleen injury highlights the dangers of splenic rupture in high-impact sports. A blow or fall can cause this delicate organ to tear, leading to internal bleeding with potentially life-threatening consequences if not promptly diagnosed and treated. Medical experts emphasize immediate evaluation for any abdominal impact in athletes.

title: CBSE school report cards: Rolled out on October 31; a reform short of transparency
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education’s (CBSE) new School Academic Performance Report Card for 2024–25 marks a major shift toward data-driven education. Offering subject-wise, gender-based, and holistic performance insights, it promises smarter academic planning. However, by keeping these reports confidential, CBSE risks diluting transparency, leaving parents unable to assess schools’ quality and accountability.

title: Powai hostage case: Ruchita Jadhav says Rohit Arya had invited her to same studio
content: In a shocking turn of events, Marathi actress Ruchita Jadhav dodged a potential hostage crisis, having been approached by the suspect, Rohit Arya, for an acting role inspired by a real-life incident. Arya had arranged to meet her at the Powai studio, the scene of the unsettling episode, but Jadhav prioritized a family obligation, ultimately grateful for her fortunate timing.

title: Shreyas Iyer: BCCI provides positive update on injury; shares roadmap
content: Shreyas Iyer has been discharged from a Sydney hospital after suffering a ruptured spleen and rib cage injury during a match against Australia. He sustained the injury while attempting a catch, leading to ICU treatment. Iyer is now recovering in Sydney and will return to India when medically cleared.

title: Bihar elections: RJD's Manoj Jha writes to EC; accuses NDA govt of violating MCC
content: RJD MP Manoj Jha has accused the Bihar government of violating the Model Code of Conduct by transferring Rs 10,000 to women under the Mukhyamantri Mahila Rojgar Yojana after the poll schedule was announced. He highlighted that further disbursements are planned before the second phase of polls, potentially influencing voters.

title: 'Rename Delhi to Indraprastha': BJP MP writes to HM; calls for installing Pandavas statues
content: Delhi BJP MP Praveen Khandelwal has urged Home Minister Amit Shah to rename the national capital 'Indraprastha,' citing its ancient heritage linked to the Pandavas.

title: "Road-Blocked On Information From Russian Side," Top Court Told In Custody Row
content: The Supreme Court has observed that it does not want to pass any order which could hurt India-Russia relationship as it expressed concern over efforts in tracing a Russian woman, who has fled to Moscow with her child amid a bitter custody battle.

title: "Society Has Accepted ": RSS Leader On Mallikarjun Kharge's "Ban" Remark
content: The face-off between the Congress and the BJP's ideological mentor Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh, has escalated with party chief Mallikarjun Kharge's comment that the organisation should be banned.

title: What's In A Name? Historians Decode The Politics Of Delhi Renaming Demand
content: What significance will remain of Netaji's 'Dilli Chalo' slogan if we erase Dilli itself? This striking question from historian Swapna Liddle cuts to the heart of the debate over the recent proposal to rename the capital city to Indraprastha.

title: "He Was Offended": Mark Carney Apologises To Trump Over Anti-Tariff Ronald Reagan Ad
content: The Canadian Prime Minister, Mark Carney, apologised to US President Donald Trump over an ad. The commercial was based on anti-tariff remarks made by former American President Ronald Reagan to criticise trade barriers.

title: "Bihari Doesn't Mean Backward": JioStar Vice Chairman Uday Shankar To NDTV
content: Ahead of the highly anticipated Bihar Assembly elections, media executive and JioStar Vice Chairman Uday Shankar made an appeal for the state to rise above its caste politics and focus on economic transformation.

title: NDTV Bihar Power Play Live Updates: BJP Will Give Eknath Shinde Treatment To Nitish Kumar, Says Kanhaiya Kumar
content: Bihar Powerplay, Assembly Election 2025 LIVE Updates: The event began with Jan Suraaj chief Prashant Kishor making a bold prediction about his party's prospects in Bihar, saying it will either win fewer than 10 seats or sweep over 150.

title: Actor Neetu Chandra's Message For Bihar Voters, And A "Trump Team" Joke
content: Actor Neetu Chandra, who is also the icon of the Election Commission's outreach to voters in Bihar, today shared a joke about what she decided to do when somebody offered her an opportunity to join politics

title: "Rahul Gandhi Shouldn't Comment": LJP's Sambhavi Choudhary On 'Drama' Remark
content: In a rebuttal to Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's comments on Prime Minister Narendra Modi's plans for a Chhath Puja, Lok Janshakti Party (Ram Vilas) MP Shambhavi Choudhary said that Rahul Gandhi "should not comment" on matters he does not understand.

title: Man Kills Co-Worker With Dumbbell After Fight Over Light Switch In Bengaluru
content: A 41-year-old man was killed by his co-worker after a fight over switching off the lights at a rented office in Bengaluru in the early hours of Saturday.

title: Maharashtra Opposition Holds March Against Voter List Irregularities
content: The Maha Vikas Aghadi comprising the Congress, Shiv Sena and NCP (SP) along with Maharashtra Navnirman Sena on Saturday held a protest march against alleged irregularities in the voter list.

title: 4-Month-Old 'Mini Tirupati' Temple Had Same Entry-Exit: Lapses Exposed
content: According to sources in the Andhra Pradesh government, an 80-year-old man, Mukunda Panda, built the temple dedicated to Lord Venkateswara on his land.

title: Chandrababu Naidu Blames Temple Authorities For Stampede, Jagan Reddy Slams Negligence
content: Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu has pinned the blame on the temple authorities after nine devotees died in a stampede at a newly constructed shrine in Andhra Pradesh's Srikakulam this morning.

title: India To Launch Heaviest Satellite For Naval Ops Tomorrow: 10 Points
content: The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) is set to launch its heaviest Bahubali rocket tomorrow. It will carry a satellite dedicated to helping the Indian Navy communicate with its assets and defend the country.

title: Kanhaiya Kumar Tells NDTV Why He's Not Fighting Bihar Election
content: Congress leader Kanhaiya Kumar explained why he is not contesting the assembly election in Bihar, despite his constant rhetoric about bringing change in his state.

title: Delhi Man, Son Fired Bullets On Diwali, Shot Reel. Now Under Arrest
content: A man and his son have been arrested from Delhi's Shastri Nagar after a viral Instagram reel showed the son firing shots in the air during Diwali celebrations.

title: Venkateswara Swamy Temple Stampede Updates: PM Modi Says He Is Pained By Andhra Stampede
content: Hundreds of devotees had gathered at the temple in Kashibugga on the occasion of 'Karthika Ekadashi'.

title: US Federal Workers Broke, Running Out Of Food As Shutdown Enters 2nd Month
content: The US government shutdown barreled towards its second month Friday and the pain is spreading fast -- with federal workers broke, food aid under threat and millions of Americans caught in the crossfire.

title: Video: Devotees Rush To Give CPR As Several Faint In Andhra Temple Stampede
content: Several devotees rushed to provide CPR (cardiopulmonary resuscitation) to those who fainted during a stampede that killed at least nine people at a temple in Andhra Pradesh's Srikakulam district on Saturday.

content: the top eight singles players and eight doubles teams advance to the semifinals . the event ends on Nov. 8 with the singles champion earning up to $5.235 million in prize money and the winning doubles team earning a maximum of $1.139 million . a total of $15.5 million dollars will be awarded to each of their respective groups .

title: Wetzel: Louisiana Gov. made finding next LSU coach harder
content: the job of hiring a new coach will fall to a subcommittee set up by the school's 17-member Board of Supervisors . the job would fall to an interim athletic director verge Ausberry . if Landry empowers president Trump to make the selection, he'll be able to hire "the best football coach there is"

title: 🎃 2025's must-see athlete Halloween costumes
content: winger Nick Foligno dressed as Philadelphia Eagles head coach Nick Sirianni . Tampa Bay Buccaneers rookies showed up for their flight as Frozone from "The Incredibles" but he dressed up as a minion from "Despicable Me"

title: Recruiting intel: Vandy coming for UGA's QB; top prospect in the middle of LSU's coaching change
content: college football teams take the field Saturday, a potentially hectic final month before the early signing period for the 2026 recruiting class . the temperature is set to rise as top uncommitted prospects and flip targets visit campuses over the final four weeks of the college football regular season .

title: Belichick on first ACC win with UNC: 'Feels great'
content: bill Belichick wins his first ACC game against the oranges . thierry henry scores a 72-yard Tar Heels touchdown . bill belichick's defense shut out the orange after intermission . the orange snapped a four-game losing streak .
